p: Dietary treatments have shown to influence the composition of gut microbiota. LAB is the most common bacteria used as probiotics and inhibits the intestinal ENT population [ 2]. Zulkifli et al. [ 30] reported that feeding a higher fiber diet may increase gut microflora population. Moreover, fermented products increase intestinal LAB, decrease intestinal pH, and increase lactic acid concentration. It is well established that the dominance of beneficial bacteria in the hostâ€™s gut can improve nutrient intake and nutrient absorption [ 58].
